thread.title: Orlando Magic give $1 million to Orlando nonprofits
thread.title_full: Orlando Magic give $1 million to Orlando nonprofits

author: Kate Santich
title: Orlando Magic give $1 million to Orlando nonprofits
text:
Orlando Magic give $1 million to Orlando nonprofits Happy day Red Huber, Orlando Sentinel Jill Raiser, board president for the Zebra Coalition, and Earl Johnson, the nonprofit's development manager, celebrate Thursday after winning one of two $100,000 grants from the Orlando Magic Youth Fund. Jill Raiser, board president for the Zebra Coalition, and Earl Johnson, the nonprofit's development manager, celebrate Thursday after winning one of two $100,000 grants from the Orlando Magic Youth Fund. (Red Huber, Orlando Sentinel) Kate Santich Public Schools, just graduated its first class last June. Of the 123 who began in 2012, all finished school, 99 were still in the program, 83 were accepted into college — many with full scholarships — and 75 were named to the National Honor Society.
“This was just a crazy dream of our board five years ago,” Panter said. “We wanted to break that cycle of generational poverty.” Caption House panel votes to kill Visit Florida 
A bill to kill Visit Florida and a swathe of economic development programs passed a House panel despite the protests of tourism officials.

A bill to kill Visit Florida and a swathe of economic development programs passed a House panel despite the protests of tourism officials. 
A bill to kill Visit Florida and a swathe of economic development programs passed a House panel despite the protests of tourism officials. Caption Disney sets 'Rivers of Light' debut and replaces 'Wishes' fireworks show 
“Rivers of Light,” the first nighttime spectacular planned for Disney’s Animal Kingdom, will debut Feb. 17, Walt Disney World announced Thursday morning. 
“Rivers of Light,” the first nighttime spectacular planned for Disney’s Animal Kingdom, will debut Feb. 17, Walt Disney World announced Thursday morning. Caption UCF 2017 football schedule released 
UCF's 2017 football schedule was released by the American Athletic Conference Thursday morning. 
UCF's 2017 football schedule was released by the American Athletic Conference Thursday morning.   Winter storm grounds flights in Orlando 
Winter storm Niko grounded 75 flights at Orlando International Airport across multiple airlines as of 10:30 a.m. Thursday morning. 
Winter storm Niko grounded 75 flights at Orlando International Airport across multiple airlines as of 10:30 a.m. Thursday morning. 
The day’s other big winner was the Zebra Coalition, which works with gay, lesbian and transgender youth who are often homeless and struggling with discrimination and self-acceptance. Since last June’s massacreat Pulse, a gay nightclub in Orlando, the coalition has seen a 25-percent rise in demand for its services. The $100,000 grant will cover housing and counseling. 
“This really helps us create a safe space for our youth,” said Earl Johnson, the organization’s development manager. 
Other grants ranged from $20,000 to $75,000 apiece for after-school and literacy programs and agencies serving at-risk youth, foster teens and kids with disabilities. 
“It’s a very emotional day — for everybody,” said Magic CEO Alex Martins . “These are organizations that don’t have big budgets and that work incredibly hard all year long. So to get a $100,000 grant really has an impact.” 
The money comes from donations and fundraising events hosted by the youth fund and is matched 50 cents on the dollar by the Robert R. McCormick Foundation. This is the ninth year it has distributed $1 million in grants. 
or 407-420-5503. Follow Kate at @katesantich
